event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: An attempt to power-off a FRU or a device has failed during a power-off sequence. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
An attempt to power-off a FRU or a device has failed during a power-off sequence.

The FRU or device that could not be powered off can be identified
from the FMRI of the fault report.

The poweroff sequence continues.

The FRU or device will be deconfigured and will not be powered up during the next power-on sequence.


The following section provides a list of the potential FRUs and devices
that can fail during a power-off sequence, and specifies the impact and
automated actions taken by the platform or domain in response to the fault.



  SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:


     FANBP_B:
     Motherboard Unit (MBU):
    
         Poweroff sequence continues.
         Platform becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:


      PSU:
 
         PSU is deconfigured.
         Poweroff sequence continues.

         If there are insufficient operational PSUs to power the platform,
         then the platform is powered down and the platform becomes unbootable.
         Otherwise, no action is taken.



      DDC on a Fan Backplane (FANBP_B):
      DDC on a Fan Backplane (FANBP_C):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         Platform becomes unbootable.
         


      DDC_A on a Motherboard:
      DDC_A on a IO Unit (IOU):
      DDC_B on a Motherboard:
      DDC_B on a DDC Riser (DDCR):
      DDCR on an IOU:
      IO Unit (IOU):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         Platform is unbootable.
     


      Memory Board (MEMB):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         Memory Board is is deconfigured.



      CPU Module (CPUM):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         CPU Module is deconfigured.





   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      PSU:

         PSU is deconfigured.
         The poweroff sequence continues.

         If there are insufficient operational PSUs to power the platform,
         then the platform is powered down and the platform becomes unbootable.
         Otherwise, no action is taken.



      DDC_A on a Backplane (BP_A):

         If the poweroff failure is detected by the DDC_A itself and the other DDC_A is operational,
         then the DDC_A is deconfigured.
         Otherwise, the platform becomes unbootable.



      Backplane (BP_A):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         Platform is unbootable.



      Slow Start Module (SSM) on an IOU:
      IO Unit (IOU):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         The IOU is deconfigured.



      CPU Module (CPUM):

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         The CPU Module is deconfigured.



      CPU/Memory Unit (CMU):
      Slow Start Module (SSM) on a CMU:

         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         The CMU is deconfigured.



      Crossbar Unit (XBU):
      Slow Start Module (SSM) on a Crossbar Unit (XBU):
 
         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         The XBU is deconfigured.

            If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
            then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

            If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
            then the platform will be powered down.


      Clock Unit (CLKU):
     
         No immediate action is taken because of this fault and the poweroff sequence continues.
         The CLKU is deconfigured.

            If this is the currently active Clock Unit, then the current standby Clock Unit
            will be used as the active Clock Unit the next time the platform is powered up.


      Switch backplane (SWBP):
      Media backplane (MEDBP):
      DVD Unit (DVDU):
      Tape Unit (TAPEU):

         Switch Backplane is deconfigured.
         DAT and DVD drives are no longer available.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the Fault Message  (two methods)


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:24:36 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 0bdc3201-2573-44c4-a674-1912bee4e115
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8004-FR for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8004-FR, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:24:36 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 0bdc3201-2573-44c4-a674-1912bee4e115
   DESC: An attempt to power-off a FRU or a device has failed during a power-off sequence.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-FR for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The poweroff sequence continues. The FRU or device will be deconfigured and will
   not be powered up during the next power-on sequence. Please consult the detail section
   of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge
   article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump  -v  -u  <Event-ID>' command
 


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u 0bdc3201-2573-44c4-a674-1912bee4e115

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:24:36.1133 0bdc3201-2573-44c4-a674-1912bee4e115 SCF-8004-FR
           100%  fault.chassis.power.power-off

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0/ssm=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0639L444:
                             part=CA06620-D301 A6:revision=0201/component=/XBU_B#0



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The poweroff sequence continues. The FRU or device will be deconfigured and will not be powered up during the next power-on sequence. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Attempt to power-off a FRU or a device failed.
